onyomiExamples.meaning: band (e.g. conduction, valence), belt (e.g. Van-Allen, asteroid, etc.)

kunyomiExamples.meaning: to wear (sword, decoration, etc.), to carry, to be entrusted (e.g. with a mission), to take on, to have a trace of, to be tinged with
obi, kimono sash, paper wrapper on books, CDs, etc., band, belt, strip, cingulum, radio or television program broadcast in the same time slot on all or most days
to wear (sword, decoration, etc.), to carry, to be entrusted (e.g. with a mission), to take on, to have a trace of, to be tinged with
obi that is not tied but merely wrapped around the body
